html:
2.6.22  5:46 pm   Do you think atoms have feelings?

      sure, if you can figure out what a feeling is

2.6.22  5:07 pm   i know i can write music, but i sometimes dont know how to start - any tips? i might try the "write something as bad as possible" business.

     yes, it looks like you have already received the tips for this scenario

     also, your music gives me motivation to write music, and that is the highest compliment i can bestow.

2.6.22  3:30 pm   how many times should i fail at something without seeing improvement before i try another strategy?

      i'd say between 2 and 24

2.6.22  3:07 pm   how often is it that you try to make "irregular" songs? or rather, how often do you try to make songs different from what you think a song is to be like?

      every time. that's the only way it works. it's kind of like running forward: you have to push against the ground backwards

2.6.22  2:54 pm   What is the first chord in your new song?

      Aadd4

2.6.22  1:19 pm   Hello Bill. You give some pretty smart answers to some of these questions, and you probably get to think about a lot of interesting and weird things because of it. Do you think that you get smarter/more thoughtful by answering these questions every day?

     a little bit

     Or does it bear no effect?

Also how often do you get asked the same questions?

      i've never been asked the same question. so far every question has been different

2.6.22  12:01 pm   is got some money the opposite of mt st helens in the sense that instead of being happy about a bad thiing youre sad about something good?

     yes, except i wouldn't consider the money song 'sad' as much as 'freaked out and nervous'

2.6.22  11:49 am   My results for this really important exams are coming tomorrow I'm super freaked out. How do i calm myself? 

      take some different exams, for fun

2.6.22  11:30 am   Do you write out week/day schedules in advance to get going? Something like "Monday: 9-10 recording vocals, 10-12 mixing project, 13-15 fun with kick drums, 15-17 writing about bicycles", etc.

     sometimtes

     I find it hard to balance between no schedule at all (nothing gets really done) or a very rigid one (I'm too afraid to even try it or I give it up quickly).

      yes i'm the same way. i have a long history with this

2.6.22  10:04 am   were you feel a great dark ages in your past?(it sounds so..)

      it's always a mix of dark and light. but sometimes my memory can be biased, depending on mood

2.6.22  8:44 am   while reading the lyrics in the questions the last few days, i noticed how vividly i had remembered your songs. as i read the words on the screen i instantly heard the melody and a whole bunch of the other stuff really easily. now i don't have perfect pitch, but when i went and checked the songs to see i was always exactly on pitch as well. this happens to me sometimes with other people's songs when i play them in my head (which i do all the time) but with yours it seems i have a much better chance. usually i can't tell at all if i'm playing a song in the wrong key in my head though, but reading your lyrics made it super vivid. it's not that i think they have to be in one key, but when i hear you singing it in my head it my memory is just especially vivid. i think i remember you saying you always do a range test for your songs. might this be part of it?

     no, i think what's happening is you have very strong sonic memory of these recordings, probably because you've heard them a lot. i've noticed that it's pretty common for people to remember the absolute pitch of familiar recordings. in fact, it might even be more common with non-musicians, because musicians might specifically train themselves so well on the relative that they almost willfully disregard the absolute

      i think a lot of other music i listen to is made before someone sings "over" it and that probably results with people singing something in a way that could have been expressed better slightly higher or lower. also interesting because i am not usually a person who digests lyrics easily. i'm terrible at remembering them, but as soon as i read them the song sprung to life

2.6.22  6:54 am   when are you going to post your next video

      paradoxically, i don't care about that. the only thing i care about is the times i post every one of my videos in the future

2.6.22  6:23 am   are you currently feeling wacky and/or goofy right now?

      no but perhaps i am anyway

2.6.22  3:56 am   what's the first thing that will be represented with one letter in the video for your next song?

      the variable 'a', unless i change that part

2.6.22  2:45 am   Which came first, the toaster or the egg?

      egg

2.6.22  2:35 am   what instrument has the worst texture

      my PR team has advised me not to say

2.6.22  1:57 am   Would you ever release a physical book of your poetry? 

      it would have to have some trick to it. otherwise i'd probably never be satisfied

2.6.22  12:39 am   how's 2022 going for you?

      ok

2.6.22  12:07 am   hey bill, im going to graduate soon, and i feel so so terrified of the future. Like my life is changing, but im not really ready for it. Have you ever felt this way?

      yes

2.5.22  11:22 pm   what are your songs about?

      they are about what currently means the most to you...... (IF the songs work. songs are a very hit and miss business)

2.5.22  9:32 pm   is music of itself or of other things?

      it's of other things, but in some cases that other thing might still find it's way into the music subject at different angle. For example, you might be using music as an element in a story about somebody building a violin

2.5.22  8:25 pm   can you play me a nice chord progression?

      no, but i'll use chords to increase the niceness of the over-all piece of content i'm delivering to you

2.5.22  8:22 pm   do you like circular TVs

      no

2.5.22  6:27 pm   do you think I could do a triathlon?

      i think you could do 3 triathlons

2.5.22  4:40 pm   why do u use so many capital letters 

      for emphasis, and style

2.5.22  2:35 pm   I'm nervous for an interview coming up today. How can I calm myself down?

      interview someone else first, to get in the mood

2.5.22  2:19 pm   What type of content motivates you the most to make?

      the kinds i've been making plus some other kinds that i probobaly won't quite say until i do it

2.5.22  12:20 pm   Saw you had a "Now Hiring All Positions" sign in the background of La de da de da de da de day oh. Will you still hire me even though I'm not a position?

      sure

2.5.22  11:49 am   hey there's a few questions i have about this song:
SLOW DOWN ANALYSIS

"look at the time, upon the wall
the clock is tellin it all wrong
you got to slow down
you got to slow down
slow it right off the wall
you got to slow down"
stop rushing.

     ironically i couldn't, because i was under enormous time pressure to write the song. but that's a coincidence

     "my hat     is bent
oh, i got a bent hat
maybe i'll slow down
and straighten it out"
continued from the previous verse, when things aren't as they should be, the solution is to slow down, stop rushing-- that's what will right the wrongs.

     in this particular song, "slow down" is a purely musical phrase. the lyrical content is actually not what i wanted to say at the time. and i tried very hard to come up with something else besides 'slow down'. but 'slow down' was the first and only good thing i could find that sounded right. to put it in context, 'slow down' was the first actual lyric i got, and the only other thing i knew was i wanted it to be a blues sequence (the chords going how they go, in those verse sections), with the 'title' being at that location (where 'slow down' is). and the first and only thing i could come up with was 'slow down', sung in that way. that's just the only thing that seemed to fit. i tried to come up with something else because it didn't 'seem' like the most interesting concept i could come up with. but i couldn't find anything else that worked as well. so i had to write the whole song around that

     "and then twist it all around
then put it down"
doing things badly on purpose, and then letting them go for a while before you get back to straightening them out

"and i'm bobblin down 124th street
and i think i'm bobblin to a brighter day"
optimism

"and the radio's playing a different kind of music
and the universe is starting t o shake"
different music=change= brighter day
shake=change=brighter day

"look at the time, it's 12;30
i'm going to hell, and i'm late for it"
if you can people feel good about something bad, then you're bulletproof in life.

"but i'll slow down
and talk about it"
going back home lyrically to say 'slowing down's gonna right your wrongs.'
this is your dissonant optimism at work: you're pretending you can SLOW DOWN to fix BEING LATE, but your conviction regarding this is so strong that you just might be right.

"and the world goes round and then comes back down"
could you talk about this a little?

     sure. that's one of the worst lines in the song. you can see with most of this, i seemed to slip into this sort of "A A B" sectionality, where i do a couple of verses, then bounce to a bridge, then do a couple more verses, then another bridge, and back. i mean, it's not bad to do that, it's just in some points it kind of feels like it's on auto-pilot. It's likely that that line "world goes round and then comes back down" seems to represent the feeling of cycling through these song sections in this way.

     i'll assume this line's meant to lead musically into the instrumental verse

[instrumental verse]


"now i'm swingin about my every daily business
and i'm pondering out about how it's daily been"
alright alright

"and it's easy to feel if you're useless
but it's strange wh en you tell your friends"
yeah. it's hard to sincerely admit your flaws without veiling it behind irony

     i changed my mind: this is the worst part of the song. i wish i could have done better. the goal-post here should be to make this have the same sort of high-flying 'sail' that the first bridge had (124th street). unfortunately i was unable to live up to this

     "so i re-loaded my fax machine with some fresh clean paper
so i can slow down and have a slow time printing it out"
fax machine is sort of odd, so that's why it's here. i don't understand what the verse MEANS, but i'm liking it texturally and rhythmically.

     right. i think after the previous bridge seemed to get us into a bland rut, i think i was reaching toward something more playful

     slowing down printing out faxes is revisiting the slowing down for being late to hell idea, i.e. it isn't something you really want to do, but it's something YOU would want to do.

"then the roof blew off again and it came back down"
parallel lyrically to the previous verse. could you talk about these two lines a little? thanks

     yes, i definitely think it reflects the sensation of cycling through these A and B sections of the song. over, and over, and over, and over again.

     "and hurricaines and storms cover the landscape
and the picture frames are floating off the wall
and the hourglass is twisting a little bit sideways
and the neighbourhood is all gone"
first: beautiful vocals
second: this is the apocalyptic nature of your works REALLY standing out-- you're bulletproof in life, truly
third: the hourglass is twisting sideways, meaning time is SLOWING DOWN, which means everything will be alright?

     i was lucky i was able to barely squeak by with something mildly original in this section. everyone can see we're dangerously close to being in a serious rut of just cycling over the form like a zombie

     "look at the time, on the wall
cuz it's going very very really slowly now"

     this part is the breakthrough, because as you can see i've finally freed myself from the prison of the never-ending sort of AABA paradigm the rest of the song has been in

     beautiful beautiful beautiful, this entire verse, and i love how the lead in to it feels like we've been 'submerged' musically somehow. great. time is going slowly now because of the 'apocalypse?'

     it's going slowly now (in a nice way) because i've finally broken out of that damn form, from before. and it just feels really good. new melodies, new content, new chords, it's like when you spend 80% of the party in 1 room and you've gotten bored of it and then you move into a new room that you never saw for the other 80% of the time

     "and it's the only thing that anybody ever talks about
and the scientists are always trying to figure out
and the physicists are always letting it bounce around"
i'll talk about these three lines at the end of the verse.

     it looks like i'm so glad to be in this section, i just wanna let it go around forever

      including an instrumental line in this entire twelve-line verse is a great choice musically, even though i don't know anything about music. this balances out the verse. freshens it up. makes people go 'ooh. let's see what's going on.'
i'm not a musician but does it mean something that the instrumental line is the sixth line?

     it seems to be on the 5th line. which is after 4 lines. in this case, the 4 lines feels like a complete unit. but the truth is, i really wanna just keep these going and stay in this section. but there's a chance that maybe i shouldn't stay any longer ...... so i guess i throw it to a musical riff because obviously i still have that melody in my head, and then the fact that we leave after 1 shows that even though we briefly considered leaving, what we really want to do is double down and stay

     like does it have anything to do with those timing things the uh TIME SIGNATURE? because like i think a waltz goes:
du DU DU
du DU DU
du DU DU
which is a regular rhythm or something
and what you've done with your verse here is go:
1
2
3,
1
2
[IRREGULARITY].


"and the novelists are typically writing stories about it
and the journalists are usually breaking news about it
and the pharmacists are frequently making drugs about it
and the charities are always raising money for it"
i think this entire verse is trying to evoke that 'diagonal' quality to it. great great great.

"and the client's name is always there
and [client's name] always cares"
beautiful end to the song. somehow you've gotten 'back home' musically not by returning to the same place but by.. . creating a new home?!?!?

     i suppose in a way, perhaps i had 'paid my dues' through the rest of the song because i had basically been feeling slightly uncomfortable/skeptical about just keeping the AABA form for so long. it felt good the first time around, but after that, there was always this skepticism about just drilling around the form like that. Was decidedly the best option at the time, but still gave me this nagging feeling of unfulfillment throughout. So it really felt refreshing to hit that outtro (everything after "very slowly now", up to the end), and that rush was enough to keep me out of the worry zone, all the way until the end

2.5.22  10:47 am   Do songs amplify, clarify, or give voices to thoughts in your head,

     yes

     or is it just me? If songs or song lyrics emotionally resonate with me, they feel more like truths than thoughts. Is it the same with you? 

     music can enhance the potency of our feelings about whatever that music is connected to

2.5.22  9:36 am   how long is a business day?

      about 1 planck, give or take

2.5.22  8:33 am   how does one become motivated

      first ask yourself 'to do what'

2.5.22  8:20 am   I asked someone I admire creatively for advice on creating things, and she said that for her it's like finding things that interest/amaze you, and replicating the feeling it gave you, in a medium you are working in. I liked her answer, what do you think? also I'd really love it if you answered the same question, as you are another person I admire creatively. what is your advice on being creative and creating things? thank you!

      it's magic. unfortunately there's no specific way to make it happen. Sometimes when you try to make it happen, that scares it away and it doesn't happen. And sometimes it happens when you least expect it. The problem with that is, i'm sure you'd like to be professional and have the ability to readily make it happen on your own schedule, rather than wait around forever. So in that case, if you're wishing to solve that, i would suggest to just move forward and just create many things, 'anything', and allow it to be 'wrong' on purpose. if you can get up the courage to do that, then that will get you into the game, and then the real magic will find you surprisingly quickly

2.5.22  7:46 am   tips for writing lyrics?

     don't forget to sing it

      Idk how to make them sound not cliché/cringe

     a good approach for this problem is to try to do it 'wrong' on purpose

2.5.22  7:05 am   if you ever had to export the stems to your song, how many stems would you organize your track into?

      it all depends on what it's being used for. it's usually best to organize it to fit the purpose

      a warm feeling, in a song

      which one

      which one

      no

2.5.22  1:36 am   is it a bad idea to try making music that's overly dramatic?

2.5.22  12:43 am   bill, why is the world so dumb? why is there such a high crime rate? why is the world being destroyed because of the human race? why are trees being cut down? what are your answers?

     this is to make the other half of the story (all the better parts) seem even better

     is the answer because of green pineapples or bored monkeys?

     no

2.4.22  10:58 pm   You probably have been asked this a lot but how do you think of your lyrics 

      melodically. and in turn i think of melodies lyrically. it's both the same thing together. but i still don't know how i think of that 1 thing

2.4.22  9:17 pm   Favorite pizza topping

      the best thing to put on pizza actually is something that goes under the pizza, it's called a table

      you might as well get started, writing worry songs, for now

2.4.22  7:03 pm   have you ever killed a man with a shovel?

      no. thank you for checking

     impossible. doesn't happen

     i will never understand how their mind works

     that's because art and minds enjoy change. you understand it, fine, but then it changes

      both

      try writing the next 10 lines in 10 different wrong ways

      not entirely
